Posts.Content: Hi everyone, I'm in.  I've just started cycle 3 of carboplatin / paclitaxil. Next infusion on Monday. Not a huge amount of side effects, just very tired a couple of days per week. No hair but still have all my nails! Started to feel a bit sorry for myself the last week or so so I need to pull myself up a bit! Xx
Posts.Title: **JUNE BREAST CANCER CHEMOTHERAPY CHAT**

Posts.Content: Hi Sorry you're here, but it's a great place for support, especially in the early days. I'm around 3 months ahead of you treatment wise and it strangely gets easier. I can actually say the word cancer out loud now!  My kids are younger than yours. It's hard when you feel responsible for upsetting them. Mine took it in their stride, but to them cancer is not as scary a word as it is to us.   You will get through this, and you'll find strength that you never realised you had xx
Posts.Title: Biopsy Results....... I'll be around for a while

Posts.Content: Hi @Lellyv My kids are 10 and 8 so I really don't know how they are going to react.  I'm self employed so I will have to work if and when I can. What about you?
Posts.Title: Chemo etc

Posts.Content: Lellyv  That's really frustrating about work. Is that all you are entitled to? I think Macmillan do financial advice if you need any help with anything.
Posts.Title: Chemo etc

Posts.Content: Hi @Lellyv I am starting chemo on 8th April and I am absolutely petrified! I have my wig and a few hats but I'm so scared of when my hair will start falling out.  I live with my two kids so I know it's difficult when there's no adult to speak to about things. I've found this forum really useful.  Xx
Posts.Title: Chemo etc

Posts.Content: Thank you everyone for your replies. I am absolutely terrified of chemo I must admit. I feel like the reality of a second diagnosis has really hit home now.
Posts.Title: Treatment plan changed

Posts.Content: I saw my surgeon  yesterday and everything has turned upside down.  My original plan was surgery then chemo. Now because I am having bilateral mastectomy and immediate reconstruction, the surgeon has said it will be 4-6 weeks before surgery can be scheduled (he has a holiday coming up). He suggested that as my cancer is aggressive I should start chemo first and get that done  rather than waiting weeks with no protection. This will give the surgeon plenty of time to schedule my op at the end of the year.  So at my appointment I had the marker fitted to the tumour and an echocardiogram. I feel like my head is spinning and I am so scared.  Meeting oncologist next week and will probably start chemo the week after.  Any advice gladly taken!!
Posts.Title: Treatment plan changed

Posts.Content: Thanks Beachwalker19  I'm having weekly chemo for 12 weeks so really don't know when it will start falling.  My hair is thin anyway so I think it will be more noticeable straight away.  Are you in the North West Tina?
Posts.Title: ***April 2019 Breast Cancer Chemo Chat***

Posts.Content: Well this is one group I really didn't want to join! Managed to avoid chemo last time I had BC, this time not so fortunate. I start on 8th April and I am absolutely terrified and can't decide what to do about the cold cap
Posts.Title: ***April 2019 Breast Cancer Chemo Chat***

Posts.Content: Hi LuckyP I'm so pleased you got through. Was it as terrifying as you thought? I just don't know what to expect. I'm also undecided about the cold cap. I just don't know what to do! Hope your SE's aren't too bad xx
Posts.Title: ***April 2019 Breast Cancer Chemo Chat***

Posts.Content: Hi claire-h I'm OK today. I'm tired as I was scared to go to sleep last night incase I didn't wake up (silly I know).  I've managed to take the dogs on a walk today in the sunshine. I guess we have to take one day at a time.  Checking for hair loss already!! Xx Nic
Posts.Title: ***April 2019 Breast Cancer Chemo Chat***

Posts.Content: Hi Ladies I was finding the matting and clumps of hair coming out quite stressful so the kids have shaved it off! Feels OK actually after the initial shock
Posts.Title: ***April 2019 Breast Cancer Chemo Chat***

Posts.Content: Hi everyone  I survived my first chemo, but what a long day! Had an hour and a half delay to start, then after steroids and anti sickness etc had to wait over an hour for my drugs to arrive! Finally out at 7.30. Am really tired but think that's with having bad dreams last night and sitting around all day. Getting a bit paranoid about my temperature and have checked it 10 times already . Hopefully I will relax a bit with it.  My mum has taken my kids away for a few days so I can see how I react to things in relative peace.  Hope everyone is doing well xx
Posts.Title: ***April 2019 Breast Cancer Chemo Chat***

Posts.Content: Hi LuckyP How did you get on today? I have been thinking about you x
Posts.Title: ***April 2019 Breast Cancer Chemo Chat***

Posts.Content: Hi @luckybealady You are having the same regime as me, but I am having paclitaxel first. I also was wondering about the cold cap every week. Hopefully someone here will have been through it.  Hope everything goes OK for you today xx
Posts.Title: ***April 2019 Breast Cancer Chemo Chat***

Posts.Content: Thanks Beachwalker19 for your reply. The unknown is so scary. I've decided not to bother with the cold cap. My hair is fine anyway and I just want to be in and out. Did yours come out in one go or was it gradual? Xx
Posts.Title: ***April 2019 Breast Cancer Chemo Chat***

Posts.Content: Well done Beachwalker19! I'm only 1 cycle down so the finishing line seems soooo far away at the moment. I've had radiotherapy before and can say it was a doddle for me xx here's hoping the same for you
Posts.Title: ***April 2019 Breast Cancer Chemo Chat***

Posts.Content: Hi I also have triple negative which is small and caught on routine.  From the research I have done weekly paclitaxel has been shown to be more effective against TN with carboplatin tri weekly. My onc said this is the most up to date effective treatment for our situation. Are you worried about the change?
Posts.Title: ***April 2019 Breast Cancer Chemo Chat***

Posts.Content: Hi everyone  I start chemo tomorrow and am very emotional today! I'm also worried because I haven't been given much information about the process and infection etc. Will I get more information tomorrow??  Thanks  Nic
Posts.Title: ***April 2019 Breast Cancer Chemo Chat***

Posts.Content: Hi there, Got my sentinel node result yesterday which was clear and so my tumour has gone transatlantic for the oncotype test. My nurse said that less than 18 low risk of recurrence and benefit of chemo small and will not outweigh risks of chemo side effects. 18 to 30, intermediate risk of recurrence and unclear whether benefits of chemo outweigh risks of side effects so they use the score of 31+ when recommending chemo. If my test comes back at 21 I won't be having chemo that's for sure. Nic
Posts.Title: Help Oncotype result!! Advice please x

Posts.Content: Hi everyone When should I expect to be scanned to check response to chemo? I've completed 2 of 6 cycles of chemo and have no idea when this will be. Not seen my oncologist since starting. Thanks everyone. Xx
Posts.Title: Scans - neoadjuvant chemo

Posts.Content: Hi everyone, One week since my lumpectomy and sentinel node removal and I feel really low.  I thought I'd feel nothing but relief when I had the cancer removed but I've actually felt worse at times. Really emotional and sad. The wait for results is obviously really stressful, but this 'sadness' has really knocked me. Got the kids to school and just cried all the way home. I don't know whether to cry and let it out or whether that will make me worse? People constantly contacting me asking if I've had any results yet, I just want to scream at them to leave me alone, then I feel terrible because I know they are only concerned about me and I should be more understanding of their feelings. But if I get one more text asking 'how are you feeling today?'.....I think I'll scream! I have no idea how I feel so how can I possibly say? The standard 'fine thanks' is getting more difficult to type. Thanks for listening xxx Nicola
Posts.Title: Struggling today

Posts.Content: Brill news!  I'm just at the beginning of my journey so good hear stories like this xx
Posts.Title: It's been a year and I'm in the clear!

Posts.Content: Hope you're ok x
Posts.Title: What today was like.....

Posts.Content: Hi I had a 23 mm tumour removed. Grade 2, no lymph node involvement. My onc said pre oncotype she wouldn't recommend chemo with my situation. My oncotype score came back after 4 weeks (should've been 2 but bc nurse forgot to send it the first time). My score was 11 so low risk of distant recurrence and so again chemo was not recommended. Nic x
Posts.Title: Will oncotype dx results be different?

Posts.Content: Hello I am in for May. Have had 4 weekly paclitaxel with carboplatin on the first and fourth week. Side effects for this week just creeping in and they tend to last 2-3 days. My wbc was at the low end last week so hoping it holds steady for Tuesday. Hope everyone is doing OK. Xx
Posts.Title: **MAY 2019 BREAST CANCER CHEMOTHERAPY CHAT**

Posts.Content: WeCanDoThis  How did you find ec in comparison to paclitaxel? Xx
Posts.Title: **MAY 2019 BREAST CANCER CHEMOTHERAPY CHAT**

Posts.Content: Well I'm pinning my hopes on the same journey because I know what to expect. It's the chemo that terrifies me more than anything if I'm honest.
Posts.Title: Cancer for a second time

Posts.Content: Hi Jump123 I hope you get better results today. I'm in at 1pm to see the breast nurse. I feel sick to my stomach!
Posts.Title: Cancer for a second time

Posts.Content: Thank you Sharon. It's so scary and like you say, exhausting x
Posts.Title: Cancer for a second time

Posts.Content: Hi WeCanDoThis was the cancer grade taken into account at all or was it simply the onc score?
Posts.Title: Cancer for a second time

Posts.Content: Thank you so much xx
Posts.Title: Cancer for a second time

Posts.Content: My gosh @WeCanDoThis we had very similar journeys last time. If your onco had come back low would you have avoided chemo again the second time?
Posts.Title: Cancer for a second time

Posts.Content: Hi Sharon I wouldn't worry. The onc test gives you a score predicting the chance of distant recurrence of the original breast cancer. What I am likely to have is a brand new primary cancer which happens in 2% of patients I believe. Lucky old me! Nic xx
Posts.Title: Cancer for a second time

Posts.Content: Hi NiceCuppa My breast nurse rang me with my score because I was waiting to see if chemo was recommended
Posts.Title: Cancer for a second time

Posts.Content: Hi everyone,  Had biopsy today for abnormality in L breast. Consultant said he's 95% sure it's cancer again. Last time was 2 years ago, right breast.  Don't know if I can do this again. So upset.
Posts.Title: Cancer for a second time

Posts.Content: Hi Buttercup123 Unfortunately I have BC again. Seeing the surgeon on Monday to discuss surgery. Then it will be chemo as biopsy showing triple negative. Very upset today. Hope you are OK x
Posts.Title: Cancer for a second time

Posts.Content: Jump123 So glad the cancer is contained! I'm OK thanks I just want the bloody thing out now!!
Posts.Title: Cancer for a second time

Posts.Content: Hi buttercup23 Yes I've been on Tamoxifen since 2017 which I'll have to keep taking.  When will your mum get her results? Xx
Posts.Title: Cancer for a second time
